content.description:
If you're not really interested in climbing the highball problems along the hardpan, Warm Point is the spot for you. You could probably spend a whole day climbing here. Probably between 10 to 15 independent problems here, most of which are in the v3-4 range.

In the spirit of adventure, I'll make this more of a description of a small cluster of boulders, rather than specific lines.

You might only see chalk on a few problems, but keep an open mind and climb on everything, you will have a good time! Lots of eliminates too if you need to make it a little more challenging for yourself.
content.protection: Flat landings everywhere. Just a pad or two is percet
content.location:
This cluster of boulders are located to the right of the parking areas. There is a single juniper tree growing in front of one of the main boulders.

The boulder directly behind the juniper tree has a few good lines, the 3-4 boulders behind it also have some great problems on them.

content.description: Nice easy line starting low and ending in the crack up the middle of the west face of the boulder.
content.location: Warm Point, this is on the west face of the second boulder from the road

content.description: Stand start on arete and low sidepull crimp on left face.  Climb up using the arete and holds on the left face.
content.location:
The arete to the right of

Aqua Nille

content.description:
Another description for a cluster of boulders.

A few slightly more interesting things on this side, including a few taller and harder problems(v5-7) and a horizontal roof as well.

Probably between 10-15 independent lines at this cluster with the majority being between v2-3
content.protection: a pad or two for most. the taller problems might require more pads/spotters
content.location:
From the parking area, look left.

The beautiful 20 degree overhanging face has a v6/7 problem, the right side of that boulder has a great v5 on it.

The rest of the problems are on the boulders to the left of it. There's a great problem that climbs out of the back of the short roof, and there are a few problems along the other sides of that block as well.

There are other lines are scattered throughout the boulders, just keep your eye out

content.description: Stand start with left facing holds in the shallow dihedral, with a waist-high boulder behind you.  Climb up and left.
content.location:
Around the corner to the right of

Aqua Nille

and Mouse on Mars, on the east face of Edgar's Boulder.

content.description: Climb Aqua Nille but, rather than jumping from the ground, do a proper start with hands on the ear and left edge and feet on the wall to lunge for the diagonal edge.
Grab the ear hold with right hand and jump from the ground to catch the diagonal edge with left hand.  Climb straight up with a dynamic finish to the lip and easy mantel.
content.protection: Several pads.  The landing is flat but there are several boulders not too far behind the climber, so it could be a little dangerous without a spotter.
content.location: Located on the south face of "Edgar's Boulder," which is the best looking block in the area, reminiscent of the Thing 1 & 2 boulders at Red Monster.  Visible from the road, and situated straight up the hill from the parking.  Look for the obvious knob/ear in the middle of the face.
